note.p: Education: Westminster School; Christ Church Oxford (1875, 1st Class Natural Science)

Career: Fellow of Balliol College, Oxford; Millard Lecturer on Physics, Trinity College, Oxford (by 1885); Duke of Bedford's Lecturer on Chemistry, Balliol College, Oxford (by 1885); Professor of Chemistry, Owen's College, Manchester (1885?)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1932 vol 134 pp i-xvii, plate, signed by H B B and W A B
References: Edmund J Bowen, 'The Balliol-Trinity Laboratories, Oxford 1853-1940' in NR 1970 vol 25 pp 227-236
